I was thinking about our obsession to create things. We create our world out of the things that we create. So Nibbāna being no thing-ness seems just right.
The things of this world are merely conventions of our own making....|Ajahn Chah in [Convention and Liberation](Collected Teachings p. 21)

During the Buddha’s time do you know anything similar to the precepts or did the precepts come after the Buddha?
People practiced a lot before the Buddha's time. Did they establish something like the precepts?
The Jain movement had quite strong ethical conduct.

When we let go of the kilesas it’s not like it’s just the absence of kilesas. There is this brightness and freeing of the heart. So the Buddha was saying there is cloud but when the cloud shifts it’s not that we’re just left with the sky but it opens up the sun. But you can’t create the sun so he says he says move the cloud away and you can’t describe the brightness of the sun is very difficult.
